heading: ge split catapults wall street
subheading: it's beginning to feel a lot like christmas in the stock market on friday as the dow jones and nasdaq climbed and climbed.
author: reuters
text: new york -- u.s. stocks held big gains in heavy afternoon trading on friday with general electric co. helping drive the dow jones industrial average into record ground on a stock split and other news. the dow jones industrial average climbed 77 points, or 0.77 percent, to 11,321, putting it within points of its closing high of 11,326.04, which was reached on aug. 25.about a third of the index's gains came from ge, the parent of the nbc television network, which set a 3-for-1 stock split and raised its quarterly dividend by 17 percent.ge, which also makes a wide array of products from jet engines to light bulbs, was up 6-1/4 at 153-3/4 on the new york stock exchange, where it was among the most actively traded issues.the nasdaq composite index was up 40 points, or 1.09 percent, at 3,755, topping the previous session's record close of 3,755. the standard & poor's 500 stock index was up 6 points, or 0.45 percent, at 1,425.big board volume of 927 million shares in early afternoon approached the amount usually seen at the end of a trading day because of "triple witching," or the simultaneous expiration of index futures, options and individual stock options."it is not a very exciting day for triple witching," said trude latimer, an independent stock market strategist based in charlottesville, va. "if it weren't for ge, there wouldn't be much going on."in the broader market, advancing issues beat declines 15 to 13 on the nyse, 57 shares were at new highs and 237 at new lows.the dow's rise was held back by j.p. morgan & co., which fell 5-5/16 to 123-9/16, after merrill lynch said it was concerned about the possibility of a potential earnings disappointment from the financial services firm's bond area.in economic news, the bond market initially rallied after news that housing starts in november fell unexpectedly by 2.3 percent to a seasonally-adjusted annual rate of 1.60 million.although the weaker starts calmed some inflationary fears, traders said, the bond market began bracing for the federal reserve's policy-setting committee meeting on tuesday.the benchmark 30-year u.s. treasury bond was down 5/32, driving the yield up to 6.40, a two-year high.analysts said they believed the stock market has not been fazed by the soaring bond yields because it has already factored in at least one rate increase next year, starting in february, regardless of the latest economic indicators."what i am hearing is that there is a lot of speculation the fed is going to raise interest rates no matter what," richard cripps, chief market strategist at legg mason wood walker.shares sensitive to the economy, including aluminum producer alcoa inc., were also helping the dow as news that the global economic picture is brightening continued to pour in.alcoa rose 4-1/8 to 80-5/8 after the european commission said the deadline for its ruling on alcoa's merger with reynolds metals co. is still set for dec. 20.on thursday, germany's key ifo business climate index surpassed expectations in november, confirming that europe's largest economy was accelerating."clearly we have a situation that shows the economy is going to be in much better shape," said bill meehan, chief market analyst at cantor fitzgerald in darien, conn."combined with the red hot economy here in the u.s., there is a good chance we would see continued strength in these economically sensitive groups."the nasdaq index was relying on established technology stocks such as microsoft corp. and chip maker intel corp., both new dow components, for leadership. microsoft was up 9/16 at 114-1/4. intel rose 1-1/2 to 82-3/4.copyright
